revised_title: Harold Clayton Urey: A Pioneering Scientist in Isotope Research
tldr: Harold Clayton Urey was a renowned American chemist who made significant contributions to the fields of thermodynamics, atomic physics, and isotope research. He is best known for his discovery of heavy hydrogen (deuterium) in 1931, for which he received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1934. Urey's work laid the foundation for modern isotope research and had a profound impact on the fields of nuclear physics, spectroscopy, and cosmochemistry.
